column1: Smoque BBQ////Luckily what Smoque does get right is their meats. The brisket is phenomenal
column2: maybe even the best sliced brisket I've ever had. It was incredibly tender
column3: almost feeling unnaturally soft as I poked my fork into it. The ribs probably appeal most to those that don't eat their barbecue with a preference. I'm no barbecue connoisseur
column4: but cooking the meat with a dry rub seems to make the meat a little tougher than what I'm used to down in Southern California. It still packs in a lot of flavor
column5: but I prefer my ribs a little more tender.
